column1: 0$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$1/15/2018 10:45:58 AM$Reviewer: cskelton1984
column2: 25-34 on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$5$5$I'm on a combo of Bupropion for ADHD
column4: and depression. The Bupropion was somewhat ineffective for ADHD
column5: but helped with the anxiety and depression
column6: so we added focalin/dexmethylphenidate. I am still taking 300mg Bupropion XL and added 10mg dexmethylphenidate er. I am very happy with the results. I feel more focused
column7: have a much greater attention to detail
column8: I am more aware of my surroundings (due to less daydreaming)
column9: just overall almost off my ADHD symptoms are significantly reduced. I experienced a very mild headache the first couple of days as well as extreme sleepiness in the afternoon
column11: those side effects have subsided. The first couple of days I also felt like I was at a loss of words
column12: like I couldn't form coherent sentences and spoke sort of robotic
column13: that also went away. My only issue is that it's going to be a pain to refill
column14: since it's a controlled drug. It's also not in stock at most pharmacies
column15: so I either have to ask around before my doctor fills it
column16: or wait. Kind of a pain
column17: but worth it in the end.

column1: 1$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$11/23/2015 7:45:47 AM$Reviewer: dee1974
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Caregiver) $4$4$4$Mother of 2 boys on Focolin XR ages 11 & 8. This med has helped both boys focus and seems to be very effective.Both boys began on brand name focolin and had few side effects
column3: 8 yo seemed to chew on things alot such as bottle tops etc
column4: the 11 yo had bouts of loss of appetite. No other side effects boys only took meds during school hours
column5: no weekends or summer and breaks from school. Teachers saw drastic improvement in both. Our family moved to another state and was prescribed the generic form both boys had severe side effects had to discontinue med. Will request ONLY brand name from now on
column6: no generic substitutes. My rating above is based on focolin xr NOT generic form of dexmethyphenidate hcl

column1: 2$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$6/16/2015 4:23:03 PM$Reviewer: NEBeachBum
column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$"I am a 19 year old female that has been prescribed every ADHD med there is on the market
column3: I am not kidding. Focalin/dexmethylphenidate is really the last one we hadn't tried. It's potentcy is double the strength of Ritalin and Methylin. Which was the last med I was prescribed before making the switch to the generic Focalin. The FDA suggested max dose is 20mg daily
column4: due to the severity of my ADHD
column5: my doctor has me on 35mg a day. I do not feel anxious and get headaches as other users have noticed from when they take it. I can't say the medicine makes me feel depressed because I also have a mood disorder
column6: in which I take medication for as well. I am very please with how Focalin has helped me
column9: and just in my everyday life. I notice that I am able to sit and focus on one task for as long as I need to and can sit still in my classes without feeling jittery or the need to talk to others around me. At work
column10: I noticed that I can sit at my cubicle all shift and my mind doesn't wander off to ""la la land"" as my mom calls it. Overall
column11: I am pleased with Focalin. The 2 side effects I notice are loss of appetite and loss of sleep
column12: but those 2 side effects have effected me with literally EVERY other ADHD med as well. I've been taking Focalin for almost 3 years
column13: and will mostly have to be on the medication the rest of my life. Focalin has been the most effective med for treating my case of ADHD"

column1: 3$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/23/2012 3:01:31 PM$Reviewer: 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$3$3$I am able to focus a lot better in school
column2: however the side effects really suck. On this drug I have gone from C's to A's and B's. The side effects that suck personally for me are the stomach cramps and mood swings. When I take the pill I feel like a zombie all day and I'm not very nice to be around. But perhaps results vary from person to person.

column4: an MRI and EEG. She is 20 years old.

column1: 6$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$8/8/2008 11:27:47 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Caregiver) $3$4$5$My son takes 10mgs in morning
column2: and 2.5 at lunch.He is a straight A student and his focus on school has only gotten better! without the meds

column1: 7$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$11/15/2007 12:14:59 PM$Reviewer: Awyldfire411
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Caregiver) $2$1$4$My son has taken focalin for 3 years now with freat results!! This past month we received the generic form dexmethylphenidate this past month our son has not been able to focus @ home or school to the point that the school nurse called me yesterday to ask if our son was still taking his meds @ home!! I have never thought generics were any different than brand names
column3: but I truly believe that this generic form is less effective than the brand name so from now on we will have our DR. write D.A.W. (dispense as written) for Focalin only.
